page.title: 13THE BLUE PETER LIFEBOAT
page.content: THE LIFEBOAT IS STATIONED AT {TREVAUNANCE BEACH}PART WAY UP THE SLIPWAY, NEXT DOOR TO THE SURF CLUB. BLUE PETER HAS JUST REPLACED THE LIFEBOAT WITH A NEW ONE FOLLOWING THE BLUE PETER CHRISTMAS APPEAL ON BBC CHILDREN'S TELEVISION. OUR LIFEBOAT IS CALLED OUT ABOUT 50 TIMES EACH YEAR.MOST RESCUES HAVE BEEN FOR RUBBER DINGYS WHICH HAVE BEEN BLOWN OUT TO SEA.OUR LIFEBOAT IS A "D CLASS" LIFEBOAT IT IS ABOUT 16 FEET LONG AND 5 FEET WIDE.MOST OF THE INSHORE LIFEBOATS HAVE OUTBOARD MOTORS CALLED MARINERS.THE INSHORE LIFEBOAT OR I.L.B. IS CONTROLLED BY 3 OR 4 MEN. THE COXSWAIN,HELMSMAN AND SOMEONE TO LOOK AFTER CASUALTIES.THE LIFEBOAT HAS A SPECIAL LOADING TROLLEY SO THAT IT CAN BE TRANSPORTED UP AND DOWN THE BEACH.
